newsitem.title: ITALY: RALLYING - MCRAE ESCAPES DELUGE, STRENGTHENS LEAD.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING - MCRAE ESCAPES DELUGE, STRENGTHENS LEAD.

text.p: Colin McRae escaped a cloudburst in the San Remo Rally on Tuesday and his good fortune boosted his victory chances.
The former world champion shot through the ninth stage near Volterra in central Italy in light rain before the deluge left his rivals ploughing through flooded roads.
Spain's Carlos Sainz, who finished the second day in second place, 32 seconds behind McRae, said: "Five minutes before we started the stage we could not even see.
"It was incredible -- like a lake," the Ford Escort driver added.

McRae momentarily lost control of his Subaru on the day's last stage. "I'm disappointed that I spun on the last one. Now it depends how the Ford goes on tarmac. We'll be OK if it's dry, but if it's wet there's no margin for error," McRae said.
McRae's team mate Piero Liatti of Italy shadowed Sainz in third place with Sweden's Kenneth Eriksson fourth in another Subaru.
Frenchman Didier Auriol dropped out of contention because his Mitsubishi was stuck in two-wheel drive for most of the day.
Drivers face another 130 km of flat out driving on asphalt on Wednesday before the rally ends in San Remo.
